title: Implement Variable.cuda and Variable.type using ATen
body_html:
This adds an optional async flag to Tensor::copy_, which attempts to do
a non-blocking copy if the one of the tensors is in pinned memory and
the other is a CUDA tensor.

I've also changed the signature of s_copy to match other functions: self is the first parameter and it has an _ suffix to signify that it's in-place.
body_text:
This adds an optional async flag to Tensor::copy_, which attempts to do
a non-blocking copy if the one of the tensors is in pinned memory and
the other is a CUDA tensor.

I've also changed the signature of s_copy to match other functions: self is the first parameter and it has an _ suffix to signify that it's in-place.
body:
```
This adds an optional async flag to Tensor::copy_, which attempts to do
a non-blocking copy if the one of the tensors is in pinned memory and
the other is a CUDA tensor.
```

I've also changed the signature of `s_copy` to match other functions: `self` is the first parameter and it has an `_` suffix to signify that it's in-place.
